1.content:
You stop at an item store, upon the recommendation of the townsfolk. There you meet the shopkeeper. A dark-elf with striking green eyes and dark silky hair that fell over her shoulders in luscious curls. Over the counter you cant help but notice her low-cut pink blouse, which proudly revealed what was at least a D-cup chest.

Forcing your gaze away you mention that you are starting a new life as an adventurer. The shopkeep smiles and explains that the local government offers starting kits for new adventurers looking to join any of the local guilds. She offers the following classes...

Warrior:
Your typical sword-wielding hero

Rogue:
One who uses stealth and cunning to overcome whatever lies in their way

Mage:
A user of magic, capable of casting powerful spells

Ranger:
A fighter attuned with nature and skilled with a bow

Artificer:
Creator of magical gadgets and machines to do all the heavy lifting for you.

Which do you choose?
1.title: Choose your class!

The choice seemed obvious, being a hero, slashing through monsters with her sword, defending cute girls with her shield, charging into danger to save the day!

The shopkeeper nods and hands you your starting kit. In it you find a tunic with a basic chest-plate, short-shorts, leather boots, leather gloves, and a sword. You equip all of these.

While here, you ask the shopkeeper if she has any quests or jobs for you to do. She nods.

Quest One:
A friend of the shopkeeper has gone missing investigating a local slime nest. It's up to you to find her and bring her home!

Quest Two:
No one has seen the blacksmith for some time, but locals claim to hear noises and see strange lights coming from the shop. Your job is to break in and find out what's happening.

Quest Three:
The Mage Guild is conducting experiments on several monsters, and could use a bodyguard in case anything goes wrong.

The Shopkeeper also mentions that the local Inn is hiring.

What will you do?

132.content:
Despite the obvious allure of helping out the shopkeeper’s friend, you decide to check the blacksmith. You figure you might be able to get an upgrade to your equipment out of the task if anything.

The elf gives you the directions through the city when you ask, and you are soon on your way.

You twirl your new staff as you walk through the twisting maze-like streets. There’s a slight sensation almost like a slow and light heartbeat within the featureless wood. From what little you know, it’s a reaction to your otherwise latent magical potential. It’s also a sign that you made the right choice.

Gripping the staff tighter and thrusting it into the sky, you focus a bit. Your reward is a small burst of sparks that fade away within a few moments. Put enough time and effort into your abilities, and that will be just an imperceptible fraction of what you might be able to do later on. Even still, you grin from the elation of having even this barest scrap of power at your fingertips.

Some uneventful minutes later, you came to the edge of the city and the blacksmith’s building. The forge is cold and hasn’t seen use in some time. Even your unskilled eye can tell that. You poke around the outside of the shop for a bit, but freeze when you hear a noise from inside. You can’t be sure, but it sounded like a scream. Gripping the staff tighter and making yourself ready, you wait and see if anything else will happen. After seconds turn into minutes though, you start to relax your guard a bit.

Coming back around to the front of the store, you try the door. Knocking at first, repeating several times with waits between gets no results. You end up with a similar response to calling out for the blacksmith to respond. Biting your lip you next try the door but find it locked. Not all that surprising, you figure.

You stare at the lock for several more seconds pondering if you should do what you are considering. Then you figure that the blacksmith is almost certain to be in trouble, and that would warrant it. With that decided you take a step back and thrust the point of your staff at the metal. Concentrating on what you hope to be a simple unlock spell, you get rewarded with a metallic clank and the door opening a hairsbreadth.

You give a quick glance all around you before moving up to the door. Trying to hear anything beyond the door doesn’t work, so you reach out and cautiously push on the door. You frown as the sunlight illuminates the space beyond the door. Rather than a rustic building like the outside suggests, you are now looking into a dark and gloomy passage made of stone blocks and extending beyond what should be possible given the size of the building from the outside.

You frown and bite your lip as you toss a mental coin before taking a quick step past the door. You leap back as quick as you can, but with no result. Several further attempts take you slightly further each time before you retreat back outside.

One final attempt gets cut short as the door slams behind you, sealing you inside the dark passage. The tip of your staff lights up enough for you to see a few steps away. The inside of the door has been changed as well, now looking like a castle’s well reinforced door rather than the door you opened from the outside.

A sudden chill sweeps up your back as a voice calls from out of the darkness, “Oh good, another plaything, do come in my dear.”

You throw your back against the door, holding your staff out in preparation but nothing comes out of the shadows, and the voice doesn’t speak up again. Now that your fear is starting to fade, you realize the voice sounded…

Your name is Pearl. You are a young woman, have just turned eighteen, heading toward the city of Tutoria to start your new life as an adventurer.

Starting appearance:

Height: 5'4"

Build: skinny
